item.title: Clip polygons in R
item.description: Clipping polygons is a common GIS task. For example, you might want to study local authorities (LADs) in the Yorkshire and the Humber region but can only obtain a shapefile with all the LADs in England. Removing all the LADs outside of the Yorkshire and the Humber can be achieved by ‘clipping’ the LADs, using the extent of the larger region as a template.
